poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Turkic hordes gallop into history. Out of it The rabble hones its hoes and spades but dulls its wit With work. It holds its hurt in prayer Hoves into song on Friday nights and Sundays Their homes with hardly room for stiff pianos Holes in the stethoscope rubber hose on bathtaps Hoards of vintage boxing cards in tins.
